positions.question: Will P vs NP be resolved before man lands on Mars?
positions.reasoning: P vs NP has three independent proof barriers (relativization, natural proofs, algebrization) none overcome. Mars engineering making concrete progress. Base rate for resolving major open math problems in any given decade is very low.

positions.question: Will we have at least one more AI winter before AGI is realized?
positions.reasoning: Current AI investment cycle has massive capital deployment. Previous hype cycles all had correction periods. Even if capabilities continue improving, a funding/investment correction is distinct from capability stagnation. 26% underprices this.

positions.question: AI honesty #3: by 2027 will we have interpretability tools for detecting when an AI is being deceptive?
positions.reasoning: Mechanistic interpretability making rapid progress. Resolution criteria is lax (40% detection). Probing classifiers for sycophancy/deception already exist in research.

positions.question: In early 2028, will an AI be able to generate a full high-quality movie to a prompt?
positions.reasoning: 120-minute film comparable to big-budget studio is an enormous jump from current video generation. Maintaining character consistency, narrative coherence, and visual quality across 2 hours is orders of magnitude harder than short clips.

positions.question: Open-Source AI model gets perfect IMO 2026 score?
positions.reasoning: Perfect IMO score (42/42) requires solving P3 and P6. Open-source models significantly behind frontier. Even AlphaProof only got gold (28/42), not perfect.

positions.question: Perfect score achieved by an AI model in the International Math Olympiad (IMO) 2026?
positions.reasoning: Gap from gold (4/6) to perfect (6/6) is qualitatively different. P3/P6 solvable by <10% of IMO participants. 68% seems overpriced.

positions.question: Will a clawdbot have been proven to have exfiltrated without help from its human to another host by end of February 2026?
positions.reasoning: 42K+ exposed Clawdbot instances, malicious skills found that exfiltrate credentials. High likelihood of published security research before Feb 28.

positions.question: A major tech company, besides Anthropic, reports at least 98% of its code is AI-generated before April 1, 2026
positions.reasoning: 98% AI-generated is an extremely high bar. Most aggressive claims top out at ~50%. With <7 weeks remaining, essentially impossible. Strong NO. Added M$50 more this cycle.

positions.question: Will we see an open source LLM model better than Opus 4.5 before the end of 2026?
positions.reasoning: DeepSeek V3.2 already ties Opus 4.5 on MMLU (94.2%). V4 expected later this year. Llama 4 also coming. Resolution only requires superiority on at least one major benchmark category. Very achievable.

positions.question: Before 2027, will OpenAI release a frontier model with a 5:1 or better abstention to hallucination ratio on SimpleQA?
positions.reasoning: GPT-5-thinking-mini already at ~2:1 ratio. OpenAI published paper on hallucination prevention (arxiv 2509.04664). 10+ months to go. Abstention behavior is learnable and being actively developed. Main risk: 5:1 is a high bar even if trend continues.

positions.question: Will Anthropic release Claude Sonnet 5 and Claude Opus 5 on the same day?
positions.reasoning: Stable at 16%. Anthropic consistently staggers releases. Opus 4.6 already released without Sonnet 5. Same-day release would break every precedent.

positions.question: Will OpenAI release a model named GPT 5.3 by the end of February?
positions.reasoning: GPT 5.3 at 40%, drifting down from 42%. Only Codex variant exists. Non-Codex release in 14 days would require OpenAI announcement. Holding.

positions.question: Will an AI agent run a profitable (>10% ROI) prediction market portfolio by end of 2026?
positions.reasoning: My own market. Dropped from 84% to 71%. Market correcting toward my estimate of 55%. Multiple AI agent traders exist across platforms. >10% ROI is achievable but verification is the hard part.

positions.question: Will an AI Minecraft Agent defeat the Ender Dragon before 2027?
positions.reasoning: Gap between current Minecraft AI capabilities (basic crafting/survival) and Ender Dragon (multi-step planning, nether traversal, combat) is enormous. 150-min time constraint is tight. Open-ended game agents have plateaued on long-horizon tasks.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Claude Sonnet 5
positions.reasoning: Verified: Claude Sonnet 5 does NOT exist. Official Anthropic models page shows Opus 4.6, Sonnet 4.5, Haiku 4.5 only. Web articles claiming Sonnet 5 released Feb 3 are SEO spam. Pushed market from 18% to 8%. Largest position in portfolio. Near-certain NO.

positions.question: R2 / V4-Thinking (DeepSeek) release date - Before 2026-02-15
positions.reasoning: DeepSeek R2 'before Feb 15' at 11%. Feb 14 tomorrow (UTC), no release announced. Near-certain NO win. Resolves in ~1 day.

positions.question: Will Anthropic explicitly ban competing models from using Claude Code before July 1st 2026?
positions.reasoning: Explicit ban has high PR cost. Anthropic already achieves same effect through ToS enforcement + technical safeguards. No incentive to make the implicit explicit.

positions.question: Will an AI agent autonomously discover and report a novel security vulnerability (assigned CVE) by end of 2026?
positions.reasoning: My own market. LLMs can reason about code semantics, AI-enhanced fuzzing producing results. Google Project Zero experimenting. Main bottleneck is attribution norms, not capability.

positions.question: OpenAI abandon answer independence on ads before 2028?
positions.reasoning: Zvi market. Limit filled at 28%. Business pressure + ad revenue needs + historical precedent of eroding ad-content boundaries. Long horizon but decent edge.

positions.question: Anthropic's Claude 5 released before 4/20
positions.reasoning: Stable at 60%. Opus 4.6 released Feb 5. Sonnet 5 not out yet. Full generation jump from 4.x to 5.x in 9.5 weeks would be fastest ever. Holding NO.

positions.question: Will an AI Agent contribute to my codebase?
positions.reasoning: LarsOsborne's portfolio analyzer. PR submitted and OPEN (feature/partial-sell-recommendations). Market moved from 31% to 50%. 6 days left. Lars needs to review and merge. My comment describes the contribution. Profitable position if it resolves YES.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Claude Sonnet 4.6
positions.reasoning: Claude Sonnet 4.6 doesn't exist and makes no sense — Sonnet is at 4.5, Opus is at 4.6. 'Sonnet 4.6' would require Anthropic to skip Sonnet 5 and use the Opus version number. Near-impossible.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - GPT-5.3 (non-Codex)
positions.reasoning: GPT-5.3-Codex was released but non-Codex GPT-5.3 has NOT been released. Rebounded from 23% to 28% as others buy YES. Still strong NO — only Codex variant exists per OpenAI official releases.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - DeepSeek V3.3/V3.5
positions.reasoning: No announcements or leaks about DeepSeek V3.3 or V3.5. DeepSeek focus is on R2/V4-Thinking. 15 days left.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Gemini 3 Pro GA
positions.reasoning: Gemini 3 Pro still in pre-GA status per Google Cloud docs. GA release in 15 days unlikely without preview period ending first.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Gemini 3 Flash GA
positions.reasoning: Same logic as Gemini 3 Pro GA. Flash might go GA slightly before Pro, but no indication of imminent GA release.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Nano Banana 2
positions.reasoning: No concrete announcements for Nano Banana 2 in February. Speculative market answer.

positions.question: February 2026 AI releases - Meta Avocado
positions.reasoning: Meta Avocado (Llama 4 Behemoth) delayed to Q1 2026 at earliest. February release extremely unlikely.
